Additionally , data collect compare corneal shape , corneal thickness , endothelial cell density , keratocyte density , corneal sensitivity , light scatter , subjective visual function two procedure .
DOC.brief_title: A Comparison Between Full Thickness Partial Thickness Corneal Transplantation Corneal Edema
DOC.detailed_description: This randomize prospective study . We enroll patient use follow inclusion exclusion criterion , base upon surgeon ? initial complete ophthalmic examination , include refraction , keratometry , slit lamp examination , intraocular pressure corneal thickness measurement , dilate fundus examination . Inclusion criterion : 1 ) Both male female eligible 2 ) Patient age 21 year old 3 ) Corneal edema due endothelial dysfunction 4 ) Aphakia , pseudophakia , cataract require extraction 5 ) Visual acuity measure standardized fashion ( ETDRS chart appropriate illumination ) 1 . Study eye ; best spectacle-corrected entrance acuity 20/40 bad 2 . Contralateral eye ; best spectacle-corrected entrance acuity equal better study eye 20/200 good . Exclusion criterion : 1 ) Central stromal corneal scar 2 ) Presence filter bleb 3 ) History Herpes simplex Herpes zoster keratitis 4 ) Uncontrolled glaucoma 5 ) Pregnancy . Serum pregnancy test perform within 7 day prior surgery woman child-bearing potential In 2-year period , January 2001 January 2003 , 67 PK ? perform Mayo Clinic endothelial dysfunction ( e.g. , Fuch ? dystrophy pseudophakic corneal edema ) patient meet entry criterion protocol . During 2-year enrollment period study , anticipate 50 patient enrol . Appropriate counseling do , include discussion potential benefit risk procedure . IRB-approved consent form sign . Enrolled patient return different day ( often day surgery morning surgery perform afternoon ) preoperative Keratogram . Randomization assignment patient DLEK PK occur preoperative Keratogram surgeon accept donor cornea eye bank procedure . Keratogram The Keratogram consist series test administer pre- post-operatively trained research personnel mask patient ? particular randomization . Keratograms perform preoperatively 1 month ( 3-6 week ) , 3 month ( 2-4 month ) , 6 month ( 5-7 month ) , 1 , 2 , 3 year ( & # 61617 ; 3 month ) postoperatively . The following measurement procedure , conduct operate eye , include Keratogram . The equipment use included parenthesis : 1 . Contrast sensitivity best refraction ( Ginsburg contrast sensitivity tester ) 2 . Straylight meter measurement ( Van den Berg straylight meter ) 3 . Corneal topography map ( TMS-2 ) 4 . Corneal profile ( Orbscan ) 5 . Noncontact endothelial photography ( Konan Robo ) 6 . Scatterometry ( Mayo scatterometer ) 7 . Corneal esthesiometry ( Belmonte esthesiometer ) 8 . Confocal microscopy ( Tandem Scanning Confoscan 3 confocal microscope ) 9 . Quality visual function questionnaire ( NEI-VFQ ) . This do 1week , one month , 3 month visit . Eligibility Fellow Eyes Fellow eye bilateral case eligible enter study 4 month first procedure eye meet eligibility criterion ( i.e. , fellow eye bad vision operate study eye ) . These eye randomize separately follow protocol , exception patient may override randomization prefers one 2 procedure . For data analysis , fellow eye consider separate group . Adverse Occurrences For DLEK , adverse occurrence time surgery ( premature entry anterior chamber recipient lamellar dissection ) require conversion standard PK patient exit study . Adverse postoperative occurrence either surgical group ( dislocate disc , uncontrolled rejection , primary graft failure , infection adverse event ) manage surgeon accord standard practice . These patient remain study identical follow-up . SURGICAL METHODS 1 . DLEK Anesthesia : Anesthesia option include monitor , attend , local anesthesia general orotracheal anesthesia , depend particular patient ? desire comorbid condition . For local anesthesia standard retrobulbar facial nerve block do standard PK utilized . Preparation recipient : 1 . In preoperative area , pilocarpine 1 % , one drop operate eye instill every five minute 3 dos order constrict pupil . 2 . After anesthesia attain eye prepare drape , lid speculum operate microscope video record case bring position . 3 . Rectus bridle suture position globe place necessary . 4 . A limbal peritomy perform conjunctiva recess 9:30 2:30 o'clock superior limbus . 5 . A limbal incision sclera , 1.0 mm peripheral limbus parallel limbus , make guard diamond knife set 0.35 mm depth . The length incision 9.0 mm 4.5mm , measure caliper . 6 . Deep lamellar dissection cornea utilizing crescent blade perform follow stromal dissector spatula . 7 . Paracentesis Healon injection maintain anterior chamber . 8 . Placement intra-lamellar trephine trephination recipient posterior stromal disc . If 4.5mm incision make , trephine use make indentation corneal surface posterior lamellar disc cut scissors . 9 . Entry anterior chamber diamond blade 12 o'clock trephination . 10 . Excision recipient posterior stromal disc endothelium corneal scissors removal disc eye . 11 . Caliper measurement diameter excise tissue record . 12 . Wound closure standard phacoemulsification IOL implantation separate incision patient require cataract removal . 13 . Healon evacuate completely anterior chamber I/A unit . ( eg : Simcoe Needle ) . 14 . The cornea cover moistened gauze disc . Preparation donor tissue 1 . Donor corneo-scleral tissue remove storage medium , endothelium coat healon , tissue secure Moria artificial anterior chamber . 2 . A deep lamellar dissection pocket form donor crescent blade follow stromal dissector spatula . 3 . The donor tissue place ( endothelial side ) onto trephination block size trephine ( size recipient disc tissue diameter ) use trephine donor disc . 4 . The donor disc separate corneo-scleral donor tissue place endothelial side fold half ( 4.5mm incision make ) onto healon coat transfer spatula . Transfer donor recipient 1 ) Air inject anterior chamber . 2 ) The donor tissue disc place anterior chamber lamellar incision . 4 ) The spatula remove eye slide Healon coating . 5 ) The disc position finely manipulate needle hook need , take care minimize endothelial touch . 5 ) The limbal wound suture interrupted 10-0 nylon suture . 6 ) The anterior chamber air bubble replace 50 % balanced salt solution . 7 ) A Seidel test performed . If positive , additional limbal suture place . 8 ) The conjunctiva close cautery suture . 9 ) Subconjunctival dexamethasone , 2 mg Solu-Medrol , 30 mg cefazolin , 25 mg gentamicin , 20 mg , inject inferior fornix . The eye bandage gauze patch Fox shield . 10 ) The patient instruct spend next two postoperative hour supine position . 11 ) Routine postoperative order corneal transplantation give upon discharge hospital day . - PK The surgical method patient randomize penetrate keratoplasty standard procedure currently practice participate surgeon . POSTOPERATIVE CARE The patient see day surgery . Postoperative medication include topical antibiotic surgeon ? choice , twice daily one two week prednisolone acetate 1 % , four time daily . The steroid drop taper one drop daily month . Alterations steroid taper medical treatment make base upon individual patient condition response . Patient activity restriction eye protection measure follow usual PK recommendation individual surgeon . All patient see follow interval : preoperatively 1 week ( 5-14 day ) , 1 month ( 3-6 week ) , 3 month ( 4-6 month ) , 6 month ( 5-7 month ) , 1 , 2 , 3 year ( & # 61617 ; 3 month ) postoperatively . Keratograms perform visit , except one day one week postoperatively . Confocal microscopy do part keratogram also one week postoperative visit . Additional clinic visit may request surgeon need proper medical management . Corneal suture removal penetrate graft limbal suture removal DLEK dictate patient heal surgeon ? discretion . DATA COLLECTION AND STATISTICAL ANALYSIS Data collection perform instrument schedule delineate Methods section . The following outcome measure calculate data . These compare 2 group ( DLEK PK ) postoperative time use t-tests rank sum test Bonferroni correction . Primary Outcome Measures 1 . Visual acuity best refractive correction 2 . Refractive astigmatism 3 . Keratometric astigmatism 4 . Topographic astigmatism ( `` Simulated Keratometry '' function TMS-1 mapping ) Secondary Outcome Measures 1 . Corneal backscattered light 2 . Ocular forward-scattered light 3 . Contrast sensitivity 4 . Posterior corneal curvature 5 . Corneal sensitivity 6 . Corneal subbasal nerve density 7 . Keratocyte density 8 . Endothelial cell density 9 . Quality visual function ( NEI-VFQ ) Statistical Power We recently publish variance data keratometric astigmatism endothelial cell density PK . The keratometric astigmatism17 removal suture 4.6 & # 61617 ; 2.7 D ( mean & # 61617 ; SD ) endothelial cell density18 2 month postoperatively 2606 & # 61617 ; 446 cells/mm2 . To detect ( & # 61537 ; =0.05 ) difference 2.5 D keratometric astigmatism 80 % certainty ( & # 61538 ; =0.2 ) would require 20 subject group , detect difference 400 cells/mm2 endothelial cell density would require 20 subject group . We expect 25 patient group , give study adequate power . For additional use data , primary outcome data patient randomized DLEK center pool data participate center Endothelial Keratoplasty Group organize Mark Terry , M.D. , Portland , OR , coordinate data collection statistical analysis . Pooled data use calculate mean postoperative visual acuity , refractive outcome frequency favorable outcome . These data compare publish data PK .
